Course Sequence

The Bachelor of Fine Arts in visual arts degree with a specialization in graphic design teaches conceptual, theoretical, and technical problem-solving skills in the context of visual communication. Youâ€™ll learn to be creative, collaborative, and critical to succeed in the competitive design profession. We utilize an interdisciplinary, cross-media approach that will inspire you to be a creator and interpreter of your environment, to develop your personal vision, and to cultivate an awareness of social responsibility through artistic contribution.

By specializing in graphic design, youâ€™ll explore both print and digital media. The curriculum also includes coursework in typography, image-making, theory and history, web design, multimedia, interface design, research, and portfolio development.

Sophomore-level graphic design courses (Design Fundamentals, Typography, Web I, Conceptual Image, and History of Graphic Design) foster critical problem-solving skills, a wide range of design knowledge, and versatile technical skills.

The third-year curriculum (Identity, 3D Graphic Design, Advanced Typography, Motion Graphics, UI/UX, and Web 2) prepares students to become design practitioners by advancing their conceptual and technical abilities.

The final three capstone courses allow you to explore your unique design interests through highly individualized and rigorous assignments.

This program takes advantage of the collegeâ€™s proximity to major museums, galleries, and collections in New York City; Philadelphia; and Washington, D.C., and exposes students to current trends and traditional concepts and techniques.

State-of-the-art facilities

TCNJâ€™s state-of-the-art facilities, venues, and equipment are a huge advantage to graphic design students. Access to the latest and most advanced technology ensures youâ€™ll be well-prepared to hit the ground running upon graduation.
